column4: Anyone have a good way to clear off a dead USB drive? magnets or something?
there is no really effective way, other than on some drives cat /dev/zero > /dev/....

or some of the wiping tools for hard drives, but some of the drives will ignore it, and there are sometimes ways of still reading some of the data afterwards. if you raelly dont want someone to see the data, destroy the thing

Well thats the trick, it doesn't show up in any OS or anything. Its "broken," and I'm going to return it to be replaced, but I want to clear it of some data I had on it. So I was thinking to put in near a large electromagnet or something?
